_header: Hail be thou Mary mild queen of heaven
_description: An Orison of the Five Joys — fourteen monorhyming quatrains plus 1 x 8, abababab at end

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Heil beo þou MarieMylde qwen of heueneBlessed is þi
                    NomeAnd good hit is to nemene…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Schild me from synne and schomeÞat I falle no
                    mareAnd send me hosul and schriftAr I heþene fare.
                    A.M.E.N.
BodEngPoeta1.Note: Fourteen monorhyming quatrains; written in half-lines.

Doyle,  I. A.,

                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Horstmann,  Carl,

EETS

Patterson,  Frank A.

Columbia University Studies in English.

CamStJohn256.First Lines:
Heyl be þu marie milde quen of heueneBlessed be þi name
                    & god it is to neuene…
CamStJohn256.Last Lines:
…In non of þe sinnes seueneþorw no fedes
                    willeNou brig my saule to heuene þerin a place to
                    fille
CamStJohn256.Note:
With rubric heading for each stanza, ‘Aue maria gracia plena
                        dominus tecum’; last stanza, abababab, is written two lines verse
                    per line of MS.
CamStJohn256.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 29-31.
Saupe,  Karen,
                        ed.  
             Middle English Marian
                    Lyrics.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 1998: 142-4; 256-7.

Lam559.First Lines:
Heyl be thow mary blisful quene of heueneand blessid be thi name
                    for good hit is to nempne…
Lam559.Last Lines:
…and bringe me to hevinther in a place to fillethat i may
                    thorow thi gracewith the wonynand be to se thi sone in
                    faceiustice & kyng so freof lyfe ȝiff me a spacethat i
                    amendid beand in heuene a place amen
Lam559.Attributed Title:
This orisone here / swynge schal be sayde vn to / oure ladi saynt marie
                    deuou / teli and with kneling (f. 15v, rubric)
